You knew he meant you and your friends, for there was a few times you had sneaked out of the village to play, and sometimes got in trouble for it. The man finally says, "Please, make my pain go away. My time has come, and I'll be with my family again. Do not feel guilty, you've done all you can. All you can do now is win and stop the war, for us and for everyone else seeking the peace."

You look at Martin who gives you a slow silent nod, and a sad expression on his face. You nod back and soon sit above the man and position your knife right towards his heart. You whisper a silent prayer taught from the anthros and soon pierce the man in the heart. He makes one last gasp smiles as his eyes shut for the final time. you keep saying your prayer for a little while and then stand up. Your friend comes over and puts an arm on your shoulders to ease your conflicting thoughts of what had happened. He then says, "Come on Lucian, lets report back to the village council. The sooner we leave this day behind the better."

You nod and soon both of you are on the move, keeping your eyes aware of your surroundings for any of the masked figures that could have fallen behind, though luckily none had. As you walk you say to Martin, "Do you think there is any hope to bring peace between our kinds."

"I think there is, and sometimes hope is the one thing the starts it, though maybe not right away. It was surprising to see a human village that cared about us rather then want us destroyed," Martin says.

"Sometimes, wish there was a way to be more anthro," you say.

"Why do you say that Lucian?" Martin asks.

"Well I just feel like I was born into the wrong kind sometimes. Don't get me wrong, I am grateful for the people accepting me for who I am instead of what I am, but I just wish there was a way to make it so I not stand out in a physical nature. I sometimes have the feeling of being a burden for being human," You say.

"Lucian, you are no burden," A voice says, and you it was your teacher, Andreas, who must have followed you to a point.

He continues saying "You are actually a help to our people. Don't just focus on the big things you have done in the years, think about the small thing you have done, like at the bakery and with the blacksmiths. Some of the things you did for them helped them out in ways you don't even notice. And if it weren't for you being here today, Martin might not be here, and the village may not know what had happened."

"But I still wish there was a way to become an anthro Andreas," you say.

"Well maybe a day will come that you get your wish, but don't get your hopes up. You may have born into the wrong world Lucian, but you will always be one of us, no matter what you look like," Andreas says.

"Your starting to sound like our mothers," Martin says.

You smile and say, "Well come on lets get back to the village. Last one there buys the meal."

"Oh yeah, first one starts the prayers," Martin says.

And soon the three of you were running towards home.
1421122211211.title: Kill them all

1421122211212.content:
Your thoughts of your fellow humans not being an enemy goes right out the window as the masked person says, "Find him! Find the anthro who wounded our soldier. Those anthros plague our world with their existence. We need to end them as soon as we can!"

You know from past observations in training that an anthro only fights to defend him/herself. They had taught you never to attack a human unless he attacks you first. The humans must have done something to make an anthro wound one of their soldiers. It was time for you and Martin to head back to the village and report. You signal Martin that it's time to leave and he agrees. You quietly head northward, doing your best to stay hidden your just about out of sight when You and Martin accidentally step on a twig. It had given away your position and the humans see both of you from a far. "Look, there's an anthro right now, and he's got one of our own, after him!"

"Run Martin!" you say as the humans are chasing you.

You run a distance from them and bot of you are much faster, being that he was anthro and you were raised by them. You keep running for a while, but then something made you look back as if something was wrong. Your instincts were right, because a human had stopped running and one was taking aim at your friend with a bow and arrow and was about to fire. As the arrow is released, you yell "No!" as you jump into the line of fire. The arrow then pierced through a gap in your armor and went into your right shoulder. You felt so much pain that you scream in agony and fall to the ground. Your friend then catches you as fall and says, "Lucian, why would you.."

You cut him off saying, "I can't watch my best friend be killed."

He was completely shocked but then both of you see the humans and they now think that you, a fellow human has betrayed them. Your friend then puts you over his back, careful not to cause more pain and says, "Let's get you back to the village."
1421122211212.title: Time to make a run for it.

choices: A few hours after you find out you are now an anthro.
14211222112121.content:
You soon are off once again and the humans decide not to follow, for you were to far ahead and back in anthro country. Martin runs for about half an hour before you have reached the village. Martin then yells as he gently sets you down, "Help we need doctor!"

The village then comes to see you are wounded, and your mother is frantic that you are hurt. "What happened to him?" your mother asks as the doctors come to help you.

"We were just about out of sight of the human village, when a noise gave away our position. We were spotted and the humans came after us. We easily out ran them, but then one took aim at me. Lucian jumped into the line of fire to protect me, but the arrow hit a weak spot his armor. I owe him one for saving me," Martin says.

The entire village was shocked at what you had done, but also very proud. "We can't pull the arrow out without causing further injury," a doctor says.

That was news that no one wanted to hear. Just then a bright light came out of nowhere and blinded everyone. Once it dimmed down, everyone sees anthro spirits from the past. "Do not fear fellow anthros for we have come to help," an anthro spirit says.

The anthros are in complete shock that some faint. The spirit continues saying, "All the spirits of the past have been watching you for a long time as you raised this young human, granted there were some times you were a bit harsh, but as he has grown he has shown qualities found more in an anthro then in a human."

The village had no idea where this was going, but the anthro finishes by saying, "We have talked it over with the human spirits and they have agreed, since his own kind now turned against him that he will become one of you, a true anthro. Please step back as we perform his transformation."

The villagers wasted no time in letting them pass. You were slipping into unconsciousness as the spirits form a circle around you and begin your transformation. You were out cold as they lift your body from the ground. Your mother wants to intervene but her fellow anthros hold her back, and she understands. You soon are engulfed in a bright light and once it has faded, you no longer were human, but a silver colored anthro wolf. They soon set your body back down and say, "Our task is complete. He is now one of you, and will longer be under threat from other anthro villages. He will be out cold for a couple of hours, so just get him back home."

The spirits soon disappear and see you in your anthro body now. Martin inspects closer and says, "His wound is gone, and so is the arrow."

The crowd give a sigh of relief and Martin says, "Lets get my friend Lucian here back home so he can rest comfortably."

The villagers then pick you up and take you back to you and your mother's hut and set you down on your bed. They soon leave to wake up the other anthros who had fainted and your mother sits close to you as you rest, waiting till you woke up to break the happy news to you.
14211222112121.title: A visit form the spirits of the past.

choices: A village council member walks up to you
You arive at Martins house and his Parents are there.
14211222112122.content:
You wake up in your bed the next day. And try sitting up only to feel a sharp pain shoot through your shoulder. This flicks your mind back to the mission, how it so quickly went from simple recon to running for your life. When you two arived at the village you're not really sure what happened. The pain from the arrow became too intence and you shortly blacked out. But from what you've been told the arrow was removed, but it was a struggle. The arrow had lodged itself into a small gap just under your shoulder blade and to remove it the healers had to cut away some more flesh.

This has now left you with a wound that hurts every time you try and move your right shoulder and to try and decreese movement a sling has Been fitted round your right arm. Seconds after sitting up your mother came rushing in saying so many things at once you only catch a word here and there. "worried, hurt, arm, brave" but from these words you can only guess that she's still feeling proud of what you did but sick with worry and also her tone indercates other emotions, guilt maybe. She must be blameing herself for not being there to protect you.

She finally stops fussing you when there is a knock at the door. She stands up and walks away. But you can hear her conversation. "oh hello there"
the other voice replied.

"is Lucian awake?" the voice belong to Martin, wait what's the time? Your look outside and see the sun high in the sky. Mid-day already? You silently laugh at this because you constently say to Martin to always be up early. The conversation between your mother and Martin goes on for a little while longer which gives you enough time to painfully get dressed in your dark green shirt and Black Trousers. By the time you've fully dressed Martin bursts through your door.

You ask in a friendly manner "how are you doing?"

Martin give you a nervious smile and replies "that's my line, you took an arrow for me, if you hadn't done that I would be..." he cuts himself of there and looks at your right arm, silently thinking about how close to death he had been. "anyway i've done all the reports and boreing stuff like that, and our training instructor seemed to beam with pride when I told him what you did." you smile at him in a way of saying thanks. his eyes flock to your shoulder and then he keeps talking "why did you do it? I might not have died but you go wounded for me."

you think this over for about a heartbeat and respond "it's what I do for my friends. No matter what situation they are in or how badly I will get hurt, I will always be there for them. Besides training would be too easy if I couldn't spar with you"

Martins eyes light up "I am glad your my friend Lucian...I bet out of all the humans and anthros your the best of them." this comment makes you feel embaressed, you've never really been good with getting praise from others so you quickly change the subject.

You ask "Hey want to go walk around the village a bit and maybe grab some breakfast...sorry lunch..,I'm starving" this brings both of you to laugh at that comment but Martin agrees. So you say where your going to your mother who gives you about a million worried comments before you and Martin can finally escape into the village.

Martin says that the both of you should go to his home to get some lunch, his parents would be more than happy to do it. So you and Martin begin the short walk towards where he lives. But on this short walk everyone you pass seems to look at you, but their eyes show a form of respect. You lean over to Martin and wisper "news travels quickly doesn't it."

Martin laughs and says "oh hehe, you have your mother to thank for that, aparently she was talking loud enough for most of the village to hear." you laugh again but that movement rewards you with another shot of pain in your shoulder. Martin seems to notice your pain and says "how much does it hurt?"

You shrug your shoulders which brings yet another stab of pain and reply "it's nothing really, also when the arrow hit it didn't seem like you would expect, I didn't feel huge pain, it just felt like getting punched and then it felt really cold...the pain only came later when we were near the village, thanks for helping me back by the way"

Martin is about to say something when.
14211222112122.title: Wounded

142112221121221.content:
You see a village counsel member named Ronak walks up to the two of you and he says, "I see you finally got back on your feet Lucian. That was quite a blow you took for Martin young one."

"I didn't want to see him get hurt sir. It's not in me to cower behind my friends and family, even if it means I have to risk my own life," you say, trying not to show embarrassment about getting praise from others (It was a flaw you were doing your best to work on).

"I wish more humans were like Lucian. If they remembered the friendship we had with them, we wouldn't have this conflict. We are all glad you are one who understands, now it just a matter of work to win the rest of the humans friendship back. The ones who are their leaders are becoming obsessed with power, and are poisoning the rest of the humans with false information. The ones in power think that humans are a better race then anthros. I don't mean to say this to offend you though Lucian," Ronak says.

"I know sir, and in all honesty, I'm glad to have been brought up by this village, rather then having been raised by the humans. I don't despise them, but I am not about to go and fight for whatever greedy cause they are fighting for, nor will I ever. My place is among you, and after what they did to me, I can see what my training instructor meant by most humans don't listen to reason. It looks like I'll have to fight before I can help to bring about peace," you say.

"Well for now you need to take it easy and let your wound heal. Oh, and we were going to wait until we knew your awake, so tonight I will have the village gather. There is something I want to give to both of you, so I sure hope you can make it. Make sure you don't do anything rough today," Ronak says.

"Don't worry, we won't sir. Have good day," Martin says.

"Have an excellent day yourselves boys," Ronak says.

"Well that was different, not every day we get a compliment from one our counsel members," you say.

"I know. Come on lets get to my place. I can already smell the roast deer that my parents must be cooking," Martin says.

"Yeah, me too," you reply.

As you keep walking towards Martin's home, your fellow villagers give you compliments on your mission, and how brave you were. You give your thanks and try not to get into to many conversations. Some of the blacksmiths let you and Martin know they have some of their armor ready to be fitted for you when you were back to full strength. You think to yourself, and are sort of hoping in a sense, 'What does everyone plan to do next, start delivering gifts to me and my mother's hut?' You throw the thought aside as you keep walking, getting looks and comments of respect from everyone you pass.
142112221121221.title: A village council member walks up to you

1421122211212211.content:
The avival at Martins house was, well unexpected. When you were aproching you could hear shouting comming from inside "you can't say that" said a male voice. An angry female voice swiftly followed by replying "I can and I will!!"

Martins ears dropped and he spoke to you quitetly "mum and dad are fighting again, they try and hide it from others but I've known for a while now...ok just make a lot of noise and they will have stopped by the time we are there. So you and Martin start talking about random things but louder than you usally would and quickly after you start you can hear that Martins parents stop talking as to try and hide their quarals from their son. Martin opens the door and happily announces that you two are here giving no evidence that he heard in his voice or actions.

You have no idea how many seconds it took, if seconds is the right words before plates of deer meat were thrust into your paws/hands and once again the praise and complments flooded you, but due to these two being your best friends parents it almost seemed like it would never end. But it made you think, wouldn't this be affecting Martin? He will Now be known as the one you saved. Almost like he was inferiour to yourself. You shake these thoughts out of your mind as you and Martin tuck into the meal that has been given to you. You then ask Martin a question "I wonder what our next mission is going to be?"

Martin replied "I'm not sure, but the information we gathered was of intrest to the higher-ups, they were really keen to know as much as they could about those guys that showed up and attacked us. They called them bounty hunters, but bounty hunters only attack their target, they are not paid to go off corse. Also who were they after that required so many of them."

You hadn't thought about this but Martin was right and you were also curious about whoever those people were trying to find. You reply "chances are in not going on any until this is healed" you indercate towards your injered arm. "who knows, we might even be sent on solo missions." you raise a clenched fist above your head then bring it down right infront of Martin and point at him making him flinch. "Martin! Your mission is to assassinate everysingle military leader the humans have, and do it before lunch time will you we are having freash rabbit?"

The two of you laugh at the joke. There is no way you'd be sent on any major missions. Not yet. A line that your training instructor said a lot was 'start low but aim high' so you two are probarly going to be sent on recon and search missions alot within the near future. Still even though you got Hurt, the rush that running for your life gave you was exilerating and more danderious missions would be more fun. A sudden thought strikes you "Martin did you leave and tracks from where we were seen to our village."

Martin smiled his calm smile that always makes you trust him "I sorted that out, I doubled back, went through the river, you know all the anti follow skills we've been taught. I was the best!" you know that he wasn't the best because both of you only just passed those tests but you trust Martin compleatly.

Martins farther then broke your conversation "your going to that meeting tonight right?...make sure you sleep before going, some of the wolves that go there like to drone on for a long time." you can see in his eyes that he's trying to say something but instead of saying anymore he just turns and leaves.

Martin then said in a over dramatic tone "meetings" then started pretending to be asleep. Which didn't last long as you flick him on the nose. Which made him get up In a start. "Hey!! You know canines hate that"

You smile "exactly" and once again you start laughing.
1421122211212211.title: Family

choices: On the way there, you bump into Martin and his folks.
14211222112122112.content:
"Well I better get going. My mother is going to be frantic if I'm gone for too long. You know how she is sometimes," You say to Martin.

"Yeah, remember that time we fell into the deep end of the pond. She wouldn't let us leave the area around the hut for a week," Martin replies.

"Yeah, 'Please don't go past the the fig tree, it could be dangerous young ones'," you say imitating your mother, making everyone laugh, including yourself to an extent.

"Well I guess I'll see you at the 'meeting'. Zzzzzzzzzzz," Martin says.

"HEY WARRIOR, FACE FORWARD, EYES OPEN, CHEST OUT, SHOULDERS BACK, EARS ON!" you yell, imitating one of the humans you had watched in training, when the teachers showed you what some humans do at a safe distance.

This made everyone laugh again as Martin imitated what you were saying. Once again you feel the pain in your shoulder. "Well, I'll see you there, or on the way," you say.

Martin nods and you soon take off, once again, being swarmed by many of the villagers as the compliment you on your bravery. Since you were alone this time, it was ten times worse. When you were with Martin, some of the comments were made towards him for helping you get back and outsmarting the humans, but now it was all about you. You were not used to such a big crowd, that you make your way through quickly but carefully, so it was not to hurt your arm. You finally get back to you and your mother's hut. Once inside, you closed the door quickly so no one else would come up and ask to come in. You don't like to be rude, but right now you were a little overwhelmed by all this publicity in the village, it made you wonder would word spread to villages other then your own, human and anthro alike, but in two different ways, one human's p.o.v. and one anthro's p.o.v., and if it did, how fast. You then hear your mother say, "Oh your finally back honey, I was beginning to worry."

You see your mother and she is in her best clothing that you are a little dumbfounded, wondering why she was dressed that way. You then snap back into reality and say, "Mom, you shouldn't worry so much about me. I'm not that little any more."

"I know, but your still my son, and it is my job to worry about you, no matter how old you are," she says as she comes up and ruffles you hair.

"Mom, come on, you know that's my weakness," you say.

"Yes, because it gets you into a good mood all the time," she says.

You couldn't argue there. Whenever you were down she always did that to cheer you up, but you didn't understand why it made you happy, especially as of recently (past few months). You threw your thoughts aside and said, "I'm going to sleep some before going to the meeting tonight. I know more then likely this meeting will be long."

Your mother nods and says, "They usually are honey. I'll wake you up when we need to get you ready, alright?"

You nod and soon lay your head down. You don't take long in drifting off to bed. Once you were asleep you start to dream. You expected to see that same vision of you as a child, but instead see something that throws you for a loop. You are in your childhood body and are being scorned once again by the anthro children and they all have darkness in their eyes. You start to run into the forest crying and you feel cold, alone, and unwanted, wishing it would end. You knew this was just a dream but you couldn't escape this one. You then feel a sense of warmth around you. It was your mother wrapping herself around you, this time she didn't have the dark eyes you had seen in so many of your nightmares, they were of light (not literally, but you get what I mean). You also did not split from your body and forest trees were not holding you back. Your mother in your dream acts like she did when the event happened and soon you head back to the village. The children all apologize and vow never to do that to you again and everyone hugs you, which was odd, because you didn't remember the hugging ever happening. Your mother then says, "Great work my son, you have overcome your nightmare by protecting a friend from danger. The dream will never be strong enough to make you tremble in fear again."

You were in complete bewilderment and say nothing, kind of enjoying your moment of belonging. You then hear your mother say, "Time to to get up my little one."

With that your eyes shot open, realizing that she really had said that. "It's time to get you ready for the village meeting tonight. Come along son," your mother says.

You get up slowly so your arm would not hurt. Then you let your mother help you get your best attire on. It wasn't much, but it was enough to impress the counsel.
Your mother and you are soon out of the door. Your mother had packed a few supplies in case you needed anything for your arm. She also brought along some of her famous deer stew, that the whole village would die for to know the recipe, but she kept it a secret, and you could hardly remember most of the ingredients.
14211222112122112.title: You leave the house

142112221121221121.content:
After you bump into Martin and his folks, you swap conversation with him and his family. You were some of the first to get there, but the rest soon poured in all the young children already asleep. All the villagers keep talking about you and Martin. Some of the older teen anthros were actually talking about how this could help you both get a girl. You were always a tad bit shy when it came to girls. For some reason you always were at a loss for words and often try to avoid talking to them. There was a lot of commotion among the crowd, then Ronak one of the council member's you talked to earlier today steps forward and says, "Attention, your attention please."

The crowd soon settles down and Ronak says, "Thank you. Now we have gathered here tonight for a special reason, if Lucian and Martin could kindly come forth."

Martin helps you to your feet to avoid you hurting yourself more. You walk up and stand next to Ronak and he says, "The reason we are here, you all may have figured by now is to honor two of our brave bravest warriors, Martin and Lucian."

The crowd clapped and he continued, "Yesterday, they took a big risk in heading toward a human village to the south, in which we have learned is housing bounty hunters. Most of you already know what they are, and for those who don't can find out later. They did their best not to be seen, but even the best of the best can make a simple mistake and get surprised by unexpected events. They had been seen by the humans and got as far ahead of them as possible. However, speed can't always outrun everything. Lucian had notice an arrow headed straight for Martin and did the noble act of jumping into the line of fire. had it not been for Lucian's presence and loyalty to his friend and village, Martin might not have made it, and had it not been for Martin's presence and loyalty, Lucian may not have come back either. These are qualities that we rarely find in the humans, but Lucian is the exception for he has proven he will stick with his people to the death (when I say people, I mean the anthros). Martin is also credited for his kindness, loyalty and bravery in the escape from the human village, for instead of running to save himself and leaving his friend to die, like most humans do (Ronak looks at you and gestures it is not towards you and you nod), he risked his own safety to help his closest friend get back to the village and also to lead the humans in the wrong direction. Their skills and training, I would say have paid off, or they might not be here tonight. That is why I am presenting them each with a medal of valor in honor of their outstanding performance."

The entire crowd cheers and everyone stands as they applaud to the two of you. Ronak has the medal on a necklace and they have the north star on them, which to you and the anthros, stood for freedom and equality on them. Ronak places the medals on each of your necks and you and Martin raise a hand in the air to show that it was a great honor. You and Martin look at each other and smile. This ceremonial meeting had made you feel like brothers. It was like nothing could come between you. You then say to Martin, "So I guess the girls will drool and pant every time they see you."

He laughs and says, "Same could be said for you 'brother', he says.

This sort of shocked you a bit and he explains, "The reason I say that is because ever since we were little, you were always one to let go and forgive, even when others insulted you. You were always coming up with new ideas to have fun, even when it was just the two of us and when we got older and started training I never went easy, because you are one to compete with, always at stalemate, and both of us gave it our all. You and I together are a force to be reckoned with. When you took that arrow yesterday, you were like a brother to me more that day then you have ever been before, and I would gladly do the same for you. Not many humans can say they have anthro for a brother."

"Or a mother," you point out and smile.

You both laugh and soon take drinks and Ronak says having heard your conversation, "A toast. To Lucian and Martin, brothers in arms, heart and in head."

"Cheers," you, Martin and the crowd say.

You were bit surprised that no one seemed to strike it as odd, but you went with it. After having some dinner and drinks you then see the girls you and Martin have had your eyes on as the crowd starts to dance to their cheerful music. "Go on Lucian, ask Rosy for a dance," Martin says.

You look nervously and say, "I Think I'll just have another drink."

"Oh no you don't," Martin says as he pulls away with your good arm and sends you into a dance with Rosy, who is careful with your arm. Martin Laughs a bit before taking up a dance with Helen. You dance for a long time before finally stopping and your mother comes over, not with anger that you risked hurting your arm, but with happiness that you were finally interacting with girls.
142112221121221121.title: Friendship and bravery.

1421122211212211211.content:
After the gathering your head was felt light. Not because you were drunk, you can't stand Alcahole. You felt light headed because of dancing with Rosy. Through out the whole time your nerves were getting the better off you. You laugh silently as you think about jumping in-front of an arrow doesn't scare you but talking to someone makes you act like a lost puppy. Who said those meetings were boreing? Your mother left about 30 minutes earlier than you because she said that she was on patrol tomorrow morning. But now after saying farewell to everyone you began the walk home. Rosy seemed kind of unhappy about your departure but was quickly swarmed by her giggling friends and you knew they would all be talking about you so you got out of there as fast as you could.

You were walking back through the village taking your time to breath the night air. Only after a few minutes did you notice that your shoulder is flareing With pain, you has taken it out of the sling before leaving because it felt ok, but now it feel like someone has raked their claws down your right shoulder blade. "must have been the danceing" you say out loud. But quickly stop as you hear a very distant shuffleing sound followed by a 'huuurrkk' kind of sound. Probarly someone being ill, one of the reasons you avoid getting drunk. But still you were drawn to the sound, something just seems off. It came from south and only the guards would be down there. Curiousoty got the better of you and you changed your corse and started walking toward the sound and away from the sounds of the gathering happening. As you get closer another thing strikes you as strange, why has there Been no further sounds?

This really doesn't feel right, somethings wrong. You reach for your dagger and find nothing. You left your weapons at home, why would you need them at the meeting. You then start a half crouched jog towards the source of the sound while remaining compleatly silent. You've been trained well enough to know that if you're not sure about the situation then stat alert. It's better to look silly than to be dead.

Your very close to where the guard should be, why hasen't he called for ID yet? You move into the shadows to hide your own shadow cast by the 3/4 moon above. Your training taught you the '5 S's and M' of camoflauge and conselment: Shape, Shine, Shadow, Siloet, Sound and Movement. If all of these can be masked then you'll be very hard to spot. Then you stopped dead. Right where the guards meant to be there's a line in the dirt, a line of something or someone that's been pulled away and into the darkness. You move closer to it and follow the track round the corner and close to the guard-hut.

That's when you see it. The guards body with a great gapping chunk of his throat sliced open with blood pouring out and around the body. You recoil in horror and make a scuffing sound. Then a figure you didn't see straight away who's by the body look towards you. He's wearing a mask just like the ones you saw before. His movements are like lightening and within a second there is a kinfe hurteling towards your head. Instint, not reactions is what makes you drop to the ground and sail right over your head, it achally cuts your fur on the top of your head. The figure then gets up and bolts towards the woods.

You only have seconds to act, you quickly shout at the top of your lungs "South side!! Guard is down!! I'm in pursuit!!" you then grab a knife from the guards body and hold it in your left hand due to your right being hurt and sprint after him. What makes you go after him alone is unknown to you, all you know is he killed the guard and your not going to just let him leave.

14211222112122112111.content:
You weren't sure if anyone had heard you, until you hear someone yell, "After him!"

You don't look back for you had been taught to never take your eyes off your target, or it will escape or get the better of you, but you had to keep your eyes open for any signs that he wasn't alone. You didn't care about the pain in your arm at this moment, all you know is the human was not gonna get away with killing one of your people. Once you were close enough, you make leap for it and tackle him. Both of you hit the ground and he scrambles to his feet as do you. He then starts to fight you in hand to hand combat. Luckily you had trained to use either hand in combat and block each attack. You are looking for a vulnerable spot to strike as you defend yourself, but then the dizziness comes back to you and you fall onto the ground. You think it is the end for you, but your fighting with the bounty hunter had given the rest of the warriors in the village enough time to catch up and they pin him to the ground. Other warriors, Martin included, come to see how you are holding up and your training instructor, Andreas says, "That took guts boy."

"No guts, no glory," you joke, making the warriors laugh.

"Well let's get you back to your mother, I don't think any of us will hear the end of this one, once she finds out," Martin says.

You all laugh and head toward the village, some of the warriors taking the human to their jail that had rarely been used, but was very strong, and unable to break out of. You know that he will be telling the council the humans plans, and in turn all warriors, yourself included will find out. Will then says, "Seems you and Martin need to catch a break, first they try to kill you for reasons outside of our village, and now this."

"It not so much fighting that worries me sir. I fear for the little ones and the people who are not trained as warriors. Do you think we should move the villagers who are not trained in combat to a safer location? I mean if one of them knows where we are, who's to say more won't come? Possibly in great numbers," You say with seriousness in your voice.

"Well once we've gotten the information we need from the bounty hunter, we'll decide the best plan of action. Until then, all you need to do is let you arm heal. Don't want one of my best warrior students becoming a cripple on me," Will says.

"It's gonna take more than an arrow to stop me from fighting for good, or send me to the pearly gates for that matter," You joke once again, and laugh about it with them.

Soon you reach the hut and you bid you friend and your teacher a good night. Soon you get you clothes off, but this wakes your mother and she asks why your back so late. You tell her what happen, dumbing down on the life threatening part, and she was in a nervous wreak. Questions like, 'What possessed you to do it?' or 'Why didn't you wait for help?' arose and you told her that you couldn't let him get away. You were pretty stubborn about backing down from fights or missions, as was Martin and your mother, and that is why you and Martin were so lethal in combat. That is why other warriors in training almost always gave up, for they knew eventually they would be beat by you or Martin. You soon say to your mother, "Mom, please be careful on patrol tomorrow."

"Don't worry son I will. I always have been. Now get some sleep," your mom says.

You finally lay your head down and rest, as does your mother.

The next morning seemed to fly by...you were waiting for the trail, it was also a very rare event for you because usally you're only allowed to go if you are 20 or above. But due to you being the only witness you've got to go and say what you saw. So here you are sitting in a circle of wolves surrounding the human flanked by your mother on the right, who reasently finished her patrol and another village member on your left who you only ever see cleaning weapons.

The main speaker of the trial, if it can even be called that, is standing next to the human who's paws are tied behind his back. The humans face mask has been removed and his face is bloody but he's smiling. The trial can't really be called a trial, it's just witnesses say what they saw, the accused says something and then he's judged. The speaker looks at you and said "Lucian please tell us here what you witnessed yesterday evening while everyone else was asleep or at the gathering."

you explain what happened about hearing the sound and with the guards death right up to when he was captured. Throughout your explanation of this there was murrnors going around the crowd and every now and then someone shouted some form of abuse. when you had finished speaking the wolf in the middle let everyone discuss this for a few minutes before turning to the human and asking "so, do you have anything to say about this?"

The human started laughing slightly. This unerved you, what could he possable be finding funny. He then spoke almost like he was talking to himself "so the rumors were true, there really is a Human working with the anthros of this village...perhaps we should have believed that human village we came across instead of killing every 3rd villager."

This comment brought a shocked gasp from most wolves there which gained another fit of laughing from the Human. The wolf beside you shouted "you even murder your own kind?!"

the human stared straight at the wolf who spoke which seemed to make the wolf shrink down. He then replied "murder? Hardly. They were harbouring a crimenal and also had wolves from this village right on their door step...not murder. JUSTISE!!"

your heart sank, the village he's talking about was the one you and Martin reconed, they killed some of them just because of a petty reason like that? "why would a group of humans attack innocent villagers let alone anyone without just cause!?"

The human turned his ice cold gaze right at you, but you held it. His eyes then flicked to your right shoulder. "ah...so your the one we shot, you know you could have just knocked your friend out of the way" he then laughed some more at his own little joke.

One of the crowd shouted "I've heard enough!! Kill him!!" 3 of the crowd drew their weapons and advanced on the human who just stayed smiling.

Just as they were about to end the humans life he spoke loud enough for you to hear. "ever wondered what those dying villagers felt?" this comment would have made you not act, but something in the way he said he, something in how his eyes flicked up just for a seconds made you react. You turned around just in time to see an arrow comming straight towards you, you ducked it and it landed right next to the human. This arrow hitting the ground halted the wolves. Everything went silent. Everything apart from a small hissing from the arrow. Everything until.

BOOM!!!

The arrow was tipped with something and it exploded into a huge cloud of gray smoke. The wolves and yourself were compleatly confused. Your mother drew her sword and started scanning around. She said "it's a smoke bomb, they'll be ok, look for who fired it." she then handed you a sna knife she had on her belt and looked you in the eyes "just encase" she said.

Soon afterwards in the confusion and chaos that the smoke had caused several other explotions happened and quickly smoke was everywhere. You could hardly see anywhere but you could clearly hear a few crys of rage and pain around you, but from where? Then sword clangs joined the mess of noise, they are in the smoke. How many? Who? Where? You couldn't focus on anything and suddenly a lone figured was lunging themselves at you. It happened so fast and so suddenly that they bowled into you knocking you flat on your back them them on top.

You hit your head as you fell over making you feel dizzy and without control. But you could see another mask figure on top of you, raising his own knife. He brought it down at you with the speed of am arrow. This is is. Your life flashed before your eyes. When you heard a thump sound and a sharp searing pain in your chest. All you could think about is "in hit, the pain, so much pain" you opened your eyes and saw your mother standing over the now unmoving masked figure.

She said "that was close" and held her paw out to you. That's when she noticed the dagger sticking out of your lower chest and the pool of blood forming around it. Her eyes went wide and instantly she dropped down and put pressure of the wound while leaving the dagger in to slow the blood flow. "Lucian!!! Lucian!! Hold on!! Do not die!!" her eyes were filling with tears as she called your name. But slowly the world started fading. You give your mother a weak smile, anything to show that it's going to be ok. You try to speak but end up coughing blood.

Vaguly you can tell that around you the smoke is clearing, and apart from your mothers voice one other was getting through to you. "I told you not to kill the human!!"...the man who was being trialed? You couldn't tell. He then spoke again " well leave you for now, but know this, this is only farewell, not goodbye!"

Soon that voice faded aswell until you could only hear your mothers crying, but that was getting more and more distant. The last thing you regestered was paniced shouts and paws grabbing you.

Then...nothing...

You awoke to see your mother sitting beside you. One of her paws holding onto your hand. You remember the last time being awake was during the ambush. You finally squeeze your mother's hand and she lifts her head in shock, happy to see you have finally awoken. "Oh, Lucian, thank the ancestors your awake. I was so worried you would never wake up," she says through her tears.

"H-how long have I been out?" you ask with agony in your voice, remembering that you had just been stabbed in the chest after you tried to move and felt searing pain across your whole chest.

"You've been out cold for the past four days honey. The entire village has been worried sick about you," your mother says.

"How many of the villagers have been hurt?" you ask, more worried about the villages safety then your own.

"Some got minor injuries in the fight, but we drove the humans off, so they won't bother us for a while and we treated every one's wounds. Yours is the most serious right now," She says.

"Why is it when ever I get close to humans or their villages, I end up bleeding?" you ask in a joking tone.

Your mother chuckles and says, "You're lucky, that dagger nearly pierced your heart."

You silently laugh but that just sends more pain through your chest. "You'll need to stay in bed for a few more days honey. The doctors say that your body should fully recover by then."

Not wanting to put up an argument with her you simply nod and say, "Well, if people want to come see me, don't let them in unless it's someone important, or if it's one my good friends like Mark or Jimmy, or if it's my teacher Andreas."

"Or Rosy," your mom adds.

"What?" you ask in shock.

"Rosy has been worried sick about you almost as much as I have. She may have a tomboyish personality, but she has her feminine and maternal side to her. She has been coming in every day to see if you were awake. She'll probably be in after the doctors check up on you. I'm going to make you some dear stew honey, you just need to rest."

"Yes mom," you say feeling a little embarrassed that you couldn't get to your feet without feeling pain.

You lay there for a while until you hear a knock at the door of your hut. When your mother opened the door, it was Martin and Jimmy.

"Hello there boys, good to see you," your mother says.

"Has Lucian awoken yet ma'am?" Jimmy asks.

"Yes, he is awake," she says.

"May we come in and speak with him?" Martin asks.

"Of course," your mother says.

"Hey Lucian, how are you?" Martin asks.

"In pain, but what else is new?" you joke.

"Man, I wish I had been there to help. I could have prevented this," Martin says.

"Trust me, Martin, the last thing we need it 'two' of the best warriors in training in a severely wounded state," Jimmy says.

"Jimmy's got a point. You might have just added to the confusion and injury," you say as you lay there.

"I know, but still," Martin says.

"Anyways, who was the human that got killed? One of the last things I heard before passing out was 'I told you not to kill the human'," you say.

"Well, actually the human's think they killed you. After seeing you lying on the ground like you were, that's what they assumed. The dagger was lodged in there pretty deep and the doctors had to be careful not to cut any vital organs pulling it out, they stitched it up pretty good though so it will heal in no time," Martin says.

"Ha, It's gonna take more then that to send me off to the pearly gates, though that was close," you say.

"Well they may use your death as leverage against us, but then again, you have the element of surprise on your side," Jimmy says.

"Well what does the council have to say about what happened?" you ask.

"Well they want to gather up the surrounding anthro villages and track the bounty hunters. But they also want to wait till you have fully recovered, they know you'll want to settle your score with them," Martin says.

"You got that right. Say, how are things with you and Helen by the way?" You ask to change topic to a lighter mood.

"It's going great, though she won't stop talking about how you and I narrowly escaped death from the human village. This will only add to that never ending story that's giving us so much praise," Martin says.

"Yeah, I'm guessing the whole village is talking about it. this might be good for us if the surrounding villages hear about everything that has been going on. Heck most of them might trust me more," you say.

"Yeah, that's for sure. Anyways, we need to get going, our folks are going to be ballistic if we are gone from home to long, most parents won't even let the young ones go outside after what happened," Jimmy says.

"And for good reason, heck I wouldn't want them being outdoors. It will calm down eventually though," you say.

"Yeah, your right. Well I hope to see you on your feet soon and we'll be coming by either later today or tomorrow," Martin says.

"See ya guys later," you say.

They soon head out the door and back to their huts and your mom comes over with the stew she had promised. Soon you are carefully sitting up so that you can eat your meal properly, even though your mother has to feed you for it was to painful to move your arms. "Just like when you were just a toddler," She says smiling.

After swallowing you say, "Don't be getting all mother of a two year old on me again, and don't get any ideas."

You remember one time you had gotten sick at the age of seven and she had treated you as if you were a baby again. You weren't even allowed to used the outhouse during that time and had to use diapers. You hoped this time she wouldn't do that, for it would feel embarrassing at this age especially.

she's right, you have no idea how you would be able to fake your death, and your not a stratigest so comming up with a plan would be tough. But you do have one idea. After Viola had left, you had found out that the medicine she had given you was to help numb the pain, and hopefully didn't wear off for a while. Throughout the day you went and told your mother the situation, and after a while of arguing, she finally agreed to it. You had packed lightly, as viola had instructed, and packed all the necessary items needed for the road. You had also packed a wooden dagger your mom had made for you when you were little. It was something you used to play games with your friends. Now it was just an item that held memories for you. You packed it to take the memories with you. Soon night had fallen, and you hear a knock at the hut. It was Martin and Jimmy with the equipment you needed, so your mom opens the door and invites them in, but then someone walked in who you didn't expect to see. It was Rosy. You were about to ask Martin when he beat you to the punch saying, "She wanted to come see you before we took off, she refused to not come, I couldn't stop her."

You only smiled and said, "It's fine. Uh, h-hi Rosy."

"Hi. You know you shouldn't have to do this," Rosy says.

"I-if I don't the entire village is still at risk of another attack," you say trying to not sound nervous.

I know, but it's just that I, I..." She didn't even finish her sentence as she jumps at you and pulls you into a kiss.

You and your friends were in complete shock. Not once had you been kissed aside from your mother kissing you on the cheek, but as you were kissing human lip to wolf lip with Rosy, you started to feel as if you were melting. It was the oddest feeling in the world, but you were tingling all over and you didn't want to stop kissing. Rosy finally pulled away and said, "I'm sorry, I shouldn't have done that."

You look at her and say, "Rosy, I-I never thought that you felt that way about me."

"Well I do, I know it seems odd, but I don't care about that. I..." You cut her off by covering her mouth and then say, "Rosy, I've felt the same way about you. I just never had the spine to tell you. I was afraid you would reject me. Martin was always trying to get me to go out with you, but I froze every time."

"It's true," Martin says.

"You mean, you feel the same way?" Rosy asks you.

"Yes, I just didn't know how you would react," you say.

"Please don't go Lucian," Rosy says.

"I have to go Rosy, it's the only way we can make the humans believe I really died," You say.

"Then I'm coming with you," She says.

"No Rosy, your safer here then out there. I don't want to risk your life, and if too many of us leave, the humans may get too suspicious. we're already risking a lot with just me, Martin and Jimmy alone," you say.

"But I don't want to lose you," Rosy says.

"Neither does my mom, and you won't. Besides, the foxes owe us one for helping them in the past, like Viola said," You say.

"Just be careful," Rosy says.

"Listen, Rosy when I get back would you, well, I don't know how else to say this, would you be my g-girlfriend?" you ask.

"Of course I will. Just make sure you do come back," Rosy says.

"Don't worry, I will. You can hold me to that," you say.

"Come on Lucian it's time to go," Jimmy says, trying to make it so it would be less hard to say goodbye.

You give Rosy a quick kiss and head over to Jimmy and Martin. Your mother then pulls you into a hug and says, "You be careful out there, you hear me. Don't make me lose my son."

"Don't worry mom. If every thing goes the way it should, I'll be back before you can say 'gifted bounty hunters'," You joke making everyone laugh.

Your mom releases you and says, "Martin, you watch over your brother, okay?"

"Don't worry ma'am, he may be a bit fragile right now, but when he is back up to full strength, he will be fiercer then ever," Martin says.

"Let's get moving guys," Jimmy says.

"You come back for both of us, okay Lucian?"

"No worries mom," You say.

Soon you were outside the village and into the forest. you kept to the shadows so you weren't easily spotted. You knew the Bounty hunters would not be operating at night, for the anthros were on high alert and had far better vision then humans, but that didn't mean other humans were trying to use the nigh as cover. You also didn't want to be seen by other anthros who may mistaken you for a murderous human. You then notices something as you progressed through the forest. Your eye sight become clearer. you thought maybe it was due to how long you've been walking. You then say, "I sure hope the other anthro villages are doing okay."

Jimmy then says, "They're fine, in fact word has been spreading to the other village leaders and their people about what you have done for us. This may gain us an advantage to gather them up and help set up a defense should the humans try and attack again. I'm sure they smile upon you or will in the near future."

"And you know, I'm sure many anthros will accept your relationship with Rosy. I know I..... Hey what's up with your eyes?" Martin asked.

This completely threw you for a loop at how fast he had changed subject. Martin had also taken notice and you ask, "What's wrong with them?"

"Well, it's nothing wrong, they just don't look human anymore, they look.....," Martin was cut of as you went to a near by pond to look at your eyes.

You look and you see that they were indeed correct. Your eyes did no longer look human, they were wolf like. "Wolf, you were going to say they look wolf like weren't you?" you ask.

Martin nods and you say, "Well now it makes sense of how I can all of the sudden see better, must have been a gift from the ancestors. This should make the trip easier. Come on, let's get moving."

As soon as he says that, you see another anthro wolf who was someone you knew from a neighboring village, your friend Kiron, who was a black anthro wolf with a white underbelly and a year older then you like Jimmy. 'Oh shit, not him too' you thought. The human then says, "Now lets take you back and that anthro back to the human village for some questioning along with that criminal the village is holding who we were hired to bring to justice as well. Or you could leave your anthro ways and join us on our conquest to destroy them, we could use your skills."

Right there you were insulted by such a thought and spit in the mans face before saying, "Go to hell."

The man wipes the spit of his face and shows a disappointed/insulted frown before saying, "Alright, bind his hands and neck together so he doesn't try to reach for his or your weapons, and search him for weapons he may be hiding."

Soon they bind your hands and neck together and take your knife you were using and as they start search you for weapons you see some of the warriors who had heard you call out the alert were hiding in the treetops ready to ambush them. You send them a signal by brushing your eyebrow twice, which meant do not attack, stay hidden and follow you from a distance once they headed off. The warriors got the signal and waited in the trees. You knew your mother would be frantic and would want to come looking for you. Soon the human leader says, "Alright men lets move out. Back to the village with our prisoners."

Soon you were on the move, two soldiers grabbing hold of you and another two grabbing hold of Kiron. You knew you had to come up with a plan to get you and him out of there. It was going to be a challenge, but you were good with coming up with strategies. The humans take you farther away from your home and you hope that your fellow warriors don't follow too close or the plan might fail. You and Kiron were dragged through the forest for five hours until you finally are in the village that you had done recon on a day ago. Villagers who are still awake watch as you are taken to the human's jail. You get comments like 'traitor' or 'anthro lover'. The second comment was true about you, but they used it as an insult. Soon you and Kiron are untied and thrown into a holding cell together, and finally you and Kiron hug each other in a friendly manner, watching out for your injured arm. Kiron then says, "Lucian, you are one stubborn kid aren't you."

"Nice to see you too Kiron," you say as you grab your arm that was in pain.

"Let me have a look at that Lucian," Korin says.

You show him your bad arm and he inspects it closely. After a while he says, "Yep it's been dislocated from that arrow."

Right after he says that he pushes it hard into your shoulder and you hear a load crack or pop, as he has put it back into place. At the same time you scream, "Yeeoooow!"

"Sorry but it had to be done, you arm should be up to full strength in a few hours," Kiron says.

"Thanks, guess I owe you one," you say.

"Don't worry about it," Kiron says.

You both then hear a man laughing. He is shadowed but you ask in annoyance, "May I ask what you find so amusing sir."

"You two. A human and a anthro working together, I never thought I would see the day. It's no wonder your mother probably abandoned you. Or were you too young to remember her walking out on you," the man says in a deep voice.

You walk up to the edge of the bars that separated you and stood firm saying "I was only an infant when my human mother abandoned me, for reasons unknown to me. I was lucky to be found by the anthro I call my mother who loves me dearly and I her. It's my human mother's loss that she gave me up. Your people speak of destroying mine. Well I listened to the stories told by human adults when I was young and trained to become a warrior. Then I listened to the anthro side and knew humans were wrong about anthros. That is why I fight on their side, but all we want is peace. It's people like you that stops that from happening."

He stands up and comes face to face with you, yet his face was still in the dark and says, "People like me? Helping the anthros is what got me thrown in here in the first place. I've been here for 3 weeks and was dreading what was to become of me. Now you arrive. Your the first human I've heard of that has been raised by the anthros. I only just realized the errors of my ways a year ago. For a while I stay under the radar, but then I need to take more drastic measures when they started mass killings in some of the villages. I was able to hamper their progress y warning some anthro villages. I stopped at a wolf anthro village that was close to here, but obviously not where you live."

"Wait a minute, Jason?" Kiron says.

"Ah, so you do recognize me. I was wondering when you would catch on Kiron," Jason said.

"Wait you know him?" you ask.
14211222112122112112.title: You are taken to the human village.

choices: The next morning, your plan is in motion.
142112221121221121121.content:
"Yes, I do know him. He is the reason I was coming here. Though not quite everything went according to plan. Jason has been in our village for the past 6 and a half months. At first we didn't trust him, but as time went on we realized he was truly on our side. He was valuable ally to our quest for peace. More people in my village have now taken a liking to both of you, especially the elders. He has been talking to human villages near the border to see what they intend to do. A few seem to have wanted to make peace, but they keep their mouths shut when that king's men come around. The human village we are in right now does not take well to anthros, and in your case traitors to their kind. No offence," Kiron says.

"None taken," you and Jason say.

"Please continue," you finish.

"Well I guess word slipped from someone outside this village that he was with us, he was taken prisoner here upon his return. As soon as we got word of his capture, we discussed if we should get him out. At first some people were against it, but after remembering the countless times he got us out of a scramble, everyone agreed that it was not right to leave him here. Me and some of the older warriors in my village were sent to break him out, but then we hit trouble. Word had not gotten to us that the human king had sent bounty hunters to take him from here and to the king. That's when their leader ordered an attack on us. Most of us headed for the trees and were out of harms way, but then one of the humans caught up to a friend of mine and I had to act fast so I wounded the bounty hunter in the fight. My friend got away but then I became separated from the rest after they had taken off knowing there were too many. The next day I was heading for my village and I was ambushed and captured, that's when I heard the lead bounty hunter say 'We got the anthro, now it's time to get that human kid we shot with the arrow away from the safety of his village.' That's how I knew about your wound and why you saw me when we left your village. Now we need to decide the best course of action for getting the three of us out of here and back to the safety of anthro country. I know your village warriors followed us and are probably making plans of their own," Kiron finishes.

"Well let's talk about how we are going to escape," Jason says, finally stepping into the moonlight to reveal a tall man with spiked black hair and blue eyes.

So the three of you come up with ideas on how to escape and see who has the better idea after discussing it.
142112221121221121121.title: Not the only one living among anthros after all.

1421122211212211211212.content:
The day had come and gone but the three of you still plotted a way out, you knew the wolves from your village would wait fir some form of signal so all you had to do was get into the cover of some trees. The hard part was getting passed the guards. Some looked pretty weak but most had a gleam in there eyes that looked like they would kill you just from a stare. But there was a few people around that you had not seen before. 4 of them. All dressed in a different form of clothing than the others, it was the same colour apart from a black trimming round the edges if it and each of them carried very strange weapons.

One of then who you guessed was female was carrying Kurni's which you didn't even know were used anymore, the second one had an exposed left a with what looked like tally mark scars on his left arm and carried 2 hooks in his hands that looked very lethal, the third was armed with a slingshot his eyes were constently alert and the way he held his weapon make it look like he was going to be nasty even in close quarters, the final one seemed to keep switching his weapons around from hammers to axes and maces. These 4 seemed to passed by every 30 minutes and each time he was carrying a different weapon.

You had asked Jason about these people and he had told you this "those 4 are their own band of hunter, they are only hired and not allowed to join any groups because their meathods are...let just say when they fight the word 'bloodbath' becomes a little more literal." even some guards are constently by your holding cell shake when those 4 get anywhere near. Jason had also said "they don't mind a bit of friendly fire aswell, so why they are here I'll never know."

At last when the moon was fully up the three of you had a plan. It started with Kiron asking waiting until only 1 guard was in sight and then saying "err...excuse me?"

The guard spoke back but he was clearly tired. Perfect. "no talking!"

Kiron when on as planned "sorry? What was that I didn't catch it." he lent slightly closer to the caged door as he said that.

The guard lent closer and once again said "no talking!"

Kiron put his ear right close to the door and asked it once more, the guare sighed, put his face right close to his ear and took a deep breath ready to shout. Now. You quickly grabbed him and gave a swift and accurate chop to the back of his neck. The guard silently fell to the ground out cold, you smile silently as you remember that you should never get in paws reach of a captive. Jason franticly looked around ready of alert you if anyone came back. You quickly set to action searching the guard for keys. But you couldn't find any.

Then Kiron pushed you aside and grabbed some small bits of metal from the guard and quickly fiddled about with the until it clicked open, he went to open Jasons lock and gave you an innocent smile that was clearly meant to mean 'what?'. You just smiled back as a reply. But this smile didn't last long as a guard came back, saw you 3 standing there, then shouted loudly "prisoners escaping!!! To arms!!! Stop the
!!!"

The guard then drew his sword and charged at the three if you. You didn't think about what to do, your body just acted on it's own. The guard brought his sword Dow. Towards you from a high swipe, you spun right to dodge, grabbed his sword arm with your unharmed arm and brought your knee straight into his face with a loud crack. Then without having to say it the three off you ran, since it was night you were conpleatly relying on Kiron to lead you. The air was filling with the noise of people shouting and running around. But Kaion was running straight towards the nearest way into the woods as planned.

However none of your planning could have got you ready for what happened next. A group of about 8 of the bounty hunters ran straight into you 3 without even relising, this knocked you off your feet. The hunters regained their bearing and saw the three of you, without hesertating they drew their weapons and attacked. But you were lucky, them drawing their weapons gave you 3 just enough time to get up and run left away from them. You are positave you felt a sword cut the heel of your boot though.

Once again it was back to running blind, hopping that yoir friend would lead you correctly. Then Jason said "guys, I've remembered something really importent!"

You shout back "it can wait." you catch up with Kiron and Jason takes your left flank. The effot was starting to make your lungs burn and lack of anything to eat was also not helping. But you pressed on. Your feet were pounding the ground but you couldn't hear it...all you could hear was the shouts of people chasing you.

But the next thing that happened would stat with you, haunt you, tourcher you for the rest of you life. Out of the darkness the guy with hooks jumps out and dug his hook straight into kaion's arm. You and Jason stopped to go and help him but a metal bulbareing smashed Into Jasons leg bringing him to one knee,probarly the slingshot guy, the girl with the Kurni's was then on him.

You relised with the worst kind of fear that you could not save both of them. Their eyes were locked with yours. Pleading. You knew you had to choose fast but also wisely. Jason had something importent to say and could be a valuable asset. But Kaion was your friend. With a cry of rage you run to save...
1421122211212211211212.title: Darkness

14211222112122112112122.content:
"Help Kiron," Jason says as he manages to break himself free of the from the grip of the girl who had the kunai's and began to fight her.

Without second thought you go to help Kiron. As the man with hooks was going for a death blow with his free hook, your right arm was now at full strength and you hit the man with a right upper cut. The man was sent flying back and his hooks with him, as it tore through some of Kiron's flesh. He screamed as the hook the hook came out and after the man laid on the ground dead as a door nail after one of his hooks went into his heart, Korin says, "A little rough, but I think we can call this even."

You smile back in reply, but it was soon gone as you and Kiron turn to go help Jason. As you come up on him you see him trying to dodge the kunai's that the woman is throwing at him, but then just as he jump from one of them the woman was quick to throw another clear at his heart. "Noooo!!!" You scream, as Jason falls to the ground.

You see that the woman has one kunai left on her and she has it tied to a rope. As she pulls it out, she swings it at you, but you were able to dodge just in time and use this chance to pull the other kunai out of Jason's chest.

At that moment you see the woman go for another swing at Kiron, but you jump and cut the rope in mid swing, sending it flying into the direction of the village and knock the woman out. You see it went flying into one of her partner,s the guy with the slingshot, making him fall dead. "I hate hitting a lady, now all we have to deal with is the guy with the heavy weapons, her, the other bounty hunters, and the villagers," you say.

"Yeah, we better get back to the forest," Kiron says.

"But what about Jason?" you ask.

"He's gone, Lucian," Kiron says.

You look over and see Jason's body laying on the ground lifeless and not breathing. You hang your head low feeling so much guilt. "Lucian, it's not your fault, you did everything you could, he died as a brave man and sacrificed himself to let us live. The least we can do is stay alive for him. Come on, lets get going," Kiron says.

You nod silently as you drop the kunai and run for the forest. The villagers and bounty hunters come to see the two of running and see Jason and the woman and the man with hooks laying on the ground. They soon are chasing after the two of you as you run and soon see that you are safely in the forest. You then whistle as a signal that you made it out, but are in trouble, and soon you see your anthro people descending from the treetops. Some of the warriors were archers ready to fire with flaming arrows. As you make it behind them, the archers fire the arrows and soon there is a wall of fire between you and the villagers as they had planned. Finally able to rest you see Martin come up to you and say, "Seems you forgot the first lesson that our teacher had taught us, never fight alone, especially when you are out numbered."

"Yeah, well you know me, I'm to stubborn to back down easily. I'll strive to be more selfless," you say.

"And more observant," Andreas says.

"Andreas, please forgive me for not being aware of my surroundings and going it alone," you say.

"It was a one off thing, your forgiven. Besides, we might not have gotten Kiron back so soon or even at all if you hadn't been for you getting captured. Just don't let it go to your head," Andreas says.

"I don't think I will," you say looking toward Kiron once more.

"Well, we better get out of here while that fire line holds them off and in the barrier of their village," Martin says.

"Yeah, let's head for the river," you say.

"You sure you can swim on your own?" Andreas asks.

You swing your right arm around and say, "Yeah, Kiron fixed me up, otherwise, I might not have been able to take on those two.... Whatever kind of bounty hunters they were. That woman seemed very foreign, unlike most humans we have encountered."

"Well descriptions will have to wait. Right now we need to get Kiron back to his village," Martin says.

You nod and soon you were off toward the river while the bounty hunters and villagers wait to put out the fire. You run further south and soon came to the river. You jumped in and let the current carry you north into anthro country. Soon you came to a safe haven deep in anthro country and terrain that was familiar to you, all of you get out of the water and everyone shakes themselves off (you being human, couldn't shake the water off like they did, so you'll be drenched for a bit). "Man, am I going to get a such mouthful when I get home. I'll never hear the end of it from my mom," you say.

"Well, it could be worse, she was begging to come along, but the council wouldn't let her. It took three of our warriors to hold her back," Martin said.

"Why didn't you let her come along?" you ask.

"Two reasons. One, she needed to stay so that she would still be around to take care of you, and two, she probably would have been on a rampage with the human villagers just to get you out of there. The humans in that village hate us too much already, and her going in there would have made the humans resent us even more," Andreas says.

"Yeesh, that wouldn't be good. Well let's get Kiron back to his people," you say.

"Right behind ya," Martin says.

Soon you start heading to Kiron's village, and think about Jason along the way.
14211222112122112112122.title: Honor one's death by living.
