142112221121221121121221.content:
Once you get to Kiron's village, you see a guard as he says, "Sir we have Kiron coming in with some fellow anthros, and a human is with them."

"Is it Jason? Did they get him out?" a deep voice says.

When Jason's name came up, you knew that this was going to be a hard story to tell. After the guard gets a closer look at you he says, "No sir it's Lucian from the neighboring village."

You then see an elder wolf (one of the council members of this village) walk out into sight and he says, "Greetings friends, I see you have brought Kiron back safely, now forgive me for being rude, but what news do you have of Jason?"

Everyone looks at you and Kiron as you hang your head low and say, "Jason didn't make it. He died when we were caught in a fight with some, shall I say, specially trained bounty hunters. He died to protect me and Kiron. He did not deserve the punishment of death."

"Lucian, you can't blame yourself for his death. Sir, if I may be so bold to speak, Jason felt he knew what he was doing, and told Lucian to help me and not him. He wouldn't have done so if he did not care about our people. I know for a fact that Lucian wanted to help both of us, and he had a hard decision to make. Jason felt he should decide for him. I am thankful that Lucian came to help me. Jason's death was not in vein, because he died so we may live. He will always be remembered as one who fought for peace," Kiron says.

"That he will boys, Jason was a brave human. Braver then most could ever hope to be. But he knew what he was risking and his journey here on Earth has ended. We would disgrace his memory if we were to sulk in his absence, and his death will be in vein if we do not continue our quest for peace. Even though we have not been able to retrieve his body, we will have a funeral for him in two weeks. For right now, you must rest easy, I'm sure you are all famished and require some food and drinks. Please follow me," the council member says.

You then all of the sudden sneeze from being drenched in your clothes. "Oh, forgive me, we best find everyone some dry clothes as well," the elder wolf says.

You all follow him as he orders some of the villagers to get some dry clothes for all of you. You finally make it to their where they hold their gatherings and there was food waiting for all of you. After getting some dry clothes on, you all take a seat and begin eating your meal, though you were lost in thought at what had happened that you were eating pretty slowly. You are unaware that your friends are watching you as you eat slowly, and just as you had just finished your last bite, Kiron nudges you and says, "Hey Lucian, you have to stop thinking about what happened. It's not healthy to be so glum dwelling on the past."

"But why couldn't I have saved him. I was sure I could have. He didn't deserve what they gave him," you say, with tears forming in your eyes.

"Lucian, there was nothing you could have done. Sometimes there are things that we can't change by ourselves. Believe me, I wish that things were better between my folks, but the only way that is going to happen is if the change the way they think about thing themselves," Martin says.

"The ancestors knew it was his time, there was nothing that would have stopped it from happening. If you had tried to help him, all three of you may be dead now, but you are still here, and Jason would have wanted the two of you to stay alive," Andreas says.

"But Jason had something important to tell us, and because we couldn't save him, we might never know what it is," you say, speaking through your tears.

"You have to stop blaming yourself Lucian, he knew that one of us needed to be saved, and he didn't want to see another young anthro's blood spilled. He acted in a noble manner, as did you. You saved my life, and he sacrificed himself to let us live. If you keep dwelling on his death, then it will have been in vein. He would want us to keep fighting and live on. We've already lost one good human to this war. Let's not lose another to grief," Kiron says.

"(sniff) Your right, we need to bring about a peace. This war can't go on forever. It was nice to know there was another human fighting for the anthros. I just hope he can find a way to help us from the afterlife," you say, regaining your composure.

"That's the spirit kid, now I'm sure that there is much to tell about these special bounty hunters you encountered, but we will wait until you have finished your drink and the village council comes by to get yours and Kiron's report," Andreas says.

"Alright," you say as you finish up your drink (It was sort of a mid evil soda for kids your age).

As you finished up, you soon see the council members walk up to you and say, "Hello once again Lucian, I must say your visit was quite unexpected this time, but word has traveled fast about what you have done for your own village. You are one brave lad indeed, and I'm glad to have you on our side. I know it must be hard for you after what has happened, but I must ask for all of us here, who are these special bounty hunters you spoke of? What do they do?"

"Well, one or two of them have died. There was a man who carried hooks, his skin was far darker then mine, so I imagine he comes from a coastal area south of here, and his tactics seemed pretty lethal. Kiron had the unfortunate encounter with his hooks," you says as you point at Kiron who had a deep cut in his arm,where blood had clotted up.

"The man with hooks sort of killed himself after I hit him with an upper cut, so we won't have to worry about him. Then there's a man who carries a sling shot. Now I know those seem old fashioned, but that man is very lethal and accurate with it, so I would watch out. His skin seem lighter, and he was smaller in size compared to the hook man's build, but I suspect these two bounty hunters were not far from each other. Now we did see a knife get thrown at him, but we did not have enough time to see if it had actually hit a vital organ in his chest or abdominal area, so I will presume slightly to severely injured at this point. Then there's a man that seems to be local to the area, but knows the others pretty well. He is a big fellow, very toned and seems to have a liking for the heavy weapons such as Maces, axes, spiked clubs, even the large hammer, so I advise attacking him from a distance or when his back is turned, if you have enough time. Then there's a women warrior, now she seems very different form the others. Her favorite weapon appears to be the kunai. I was surprised myself to find out myself that they are still in use, and I'm sure Kiron is too. The woman may be from a land that's across the sea," you say.

"Are you sure," the council member says.

"I agree with him sir, It seems one of the human kings will go to any extreme to push the anthros farther north or wipe us out for good, and the only human clans that I know that still use kunai are those who live in the far eastern part of the world," Kiron says.

"Well now that we have this information, we will be sending messengers to the other villages to let them know what we have found out. I'm sure you will be reporting this to your own village," the councils member says.

"Yes sir," you say.

"Well I suppose we will let you and your fellow village warriors be on your way if you want to make it home before late afternoon. Remember, your welcome to our village anytime you wish to visit, and thank you for bringing back Kiron safely," the council member says again.

He holds out his paw and you shake it with yours. Soon after, you walk over and give Kiron a friendship hug, bidding him farewell as you and your fellow warriors take off.

14213.content:
It was Fifteen years later and you had grown into a fine strong human (Stronger then most of your own kind). Your had brought to the village when you were just an infant by your adopted mother, Lila, a Tan colored anthro wolfess with long brown hair, who vowed to raise you as her own, and she had named you Terra, which meant strong heart in their time. The anthros (all wolves) were touched rather then disgusted by her actions, for they had never seen a human baby before and all knew that if they raised you from this age and taught you the ways of the anthro and how the humans had wronged them for false crimes, you would find a way to bring about a common peace. The Council of the central village in which you now dwell and was the anthros stronghold in case of a large scale attack, easily accepted you and vowed to help with your protection against enemy forces. The village had kept you and the anthro children far from the humans for ten years and finally let you see what the humans did and said about anthros so you could know why the humans hated them. Not all surrounding anthro wolf villages approved of your presence among them and were always on alert when they were around you, though you always showed them kindness and trust and would not turn your back on the anthros no matter what, even after hearing the human side of the story. You always knew you were different in appearance, but many of the anthro adults had taken to notice the your personality was of anthro origin. At first they thought it was because of the way your adopted mother had raised you, but then found out a far deeper secret that explained why you were who you were and possibly why fate had brought you to them in the first place. When the other villages had learned of the secret, they understood why you were placed among them and treated you with more gratitude. What the secret was, you did not know, but would be told when the time was right. Tonight, you were heading back home from the the archery range with your bow and arrows, which archery was what you excelled in, even though you had some skill in swordsmanship, as did most, your one weakness was in spear throwing. You could easily jab, for you had good footing, but when you threw, your spear never seemed hit the target right at dead center, of course you weren't the only one who showed that weakness. Your best friend Aden, who was same age as you and was an anthro wolf with brown fur, also showed that flaw. As you walk home, you think about what tomorrow will bring, for tomorrow was choosing day, where you would be chosen to perform a certain specialty for the rest of your life. You hoped you and you friend Aden would become knights or anything that came close, such as the anthros rangers (who in this story are the ones of stealth and agility), who always seemed mysterious for some reason, and were of interest to you, even though they rarely were chosen. You hoped not to be place in some boring job such as farming, even though you knew how to farm a bit. You felt it would disgrace your mothers image if that happened. Your train thought stopped as a silver colored anthro wolf named Luri, Aden's year older sister and a girl you had major crush on, but were always afraid to talk to (which was another one of your weaknesses), comes up to you and asks, "How did you do at the archery range today?"

"Um.....okay I g-guess," You say nervously.

Luri giggles at your nervousness and says, "It was better than okay from what I've heard Terra."

You laugh nervously and Aden walks up and says, "I see my sister is making you nervous again."

"How is it going Aden?" You ask.

"Oh not to bad, getting ready for the choosing tomorrow. How do you feel about it?" he asks.

"A little overwhelmed. I don't want to disappoint my mother and hope I don't get assigned to some low type job. But hey, if that is what happens I can't change it," you say.

"Yeah I'm pretty nervous myself. Hope they don't make me a cook because of my sister, because I know diddly squat about cooking, no offense sis," Aden says.

"None taken little bro," Luri says.

"Besides, your one of the best young archers the village has seen in years. They definitely have to give you something good," Aden says.

"Terra, Dinners ready. Better get it while it's hot," Your mother says.

You lived right next door to your friend and had always played with him and his sister in your early years. His Parents and your mother were good friends and always talked about how the three of you got along. "Well I'll see you at the choosing tomorrow. Hopefully we both get something good," you say.

"See ya," they both say as they head over to their parents who had been watching you all with a smile.

You get inside and your mother had just pull out some oven roasted ham slices and bread. She had also made some broccoli, which wasn't your most favorite, but you would still eat it. You soon start eating as your mother asks, "So how was your day?"

You swallow and say, "It was okay, had a few sloppy practice shots then used my concentration and hit the bulls-eye every time."

"That's good honey, that should help you in the choosing tomorrow," she says.

"I sure hope so," you reply.

"Don't worry, whatever duty they assign you, it will be for a reason, and I'll be proud of you no matter what," she says.

"Thanks mom," you say, with a little doubt.

You soon finish your meal and your mother says, "You better get a good night's rest dear. You'll need to be up bright and early tomorrow for the choosing."

"Yes mom," you agree.

You soon get changed into your evening attire and drift off to sleep, as does your mother.

142131.content:
It was finally the day of the choosing, and you did your best to hide your nervousness. Your mother stood in the crowd and waited as each 15 year old was being assigned their jobs. Some were assigned a blacksmith's apprentice, some a stable master's apprentice, some were assigned as a cook's apprentice, some were apprenticed to Scribes or council members, and some were knight's apprentices, it came to you. You were to go just before Aden and you stand in front of the council members and the instructors. You then hear one of the council members say, "State your name son."

"Terra sir," You answer.

"Tell us young Terra, what skills do feel you have to offer our village?" a council member says.

The council member then says, "Well you do show some of the skill set needed for a knight, then again......"

This came as a shock to you and others and you were completely speechless. Rangers rarely pick apprentices, and to be picked by one was a great honor, but you soon realized that you had the skills needed for the job. You were fast, agile, and on several occasions were able to sneak up on your friends without them sensing your presence, even with their keen sense of smell. You were also good at climbing, and at one time or another, escaped danger from wild animals by seeking safety in the trees. "So do you accept young one?" the council member asks.

"Yes sir, I do accept," you say with quick enthusiasm.

"Then take your place by your new teacher," The council member says.

You bow in respect and walk to your new teacher, who is a Black colored anthro wolf in a camouflage cloak. He nods and gives a quick smile as you stand next to him. Your friend was next and he too became the ranger's apprentice. Both of you were honored to have been picked by him and soon the rest were assigned to their new duties as apprentices.

"Meet me here at eight tomorrow boys. I'll let you enjoy today. You two are going to have a lot of training coming your way. By the way, my name's Talcane," the ranger says.

"It's honor to be your apprentices sir," You say and Aden nods.

"Well off with you two now. I'm sure you are both eager to tell your folks if they don't already know," he says.

You both nod and take off to see your mother, who congrats both of you for your apprenticeship. "We better go home and celebrate with Aden's folks," she says, and you are soon off towards your homes.

151.content:
Your name is Troy Conner. It was the year 1994 when it all happened, your family and you are part of a group of humans who are friends with anthro Wolves and Foxes (Which are the only two types of anthros in this story). You had many friends who were anthros, especially my best friend, Jones Martin(or as you like to call him Jonesey), who was an anthro wolf that had silver fur and green eyes, and you also had human friends. Jones, you, your twin brother James Conner, and some of your other friends went and joined the military, Navy S.E.A.L.s to be exact, and took out what ever enemies threatened your way of life in your once proud country. But all that changed when after a few weeks of being home from your last mission, the human President of the United States declares war against all the anthros and anyone who will side with them, after a massacre of a small city (that was made mostly of humans) had taken place and all ships and human soldiers were called back home and ordered to bring in all anthro military personnel. When the declaration of war had been declared, your friends, you and your brother knew that you were all in danger, and had to get yourselves out of California, where you were stationed, and back to the north bordering states, so that night you found what ammunition and firearms that you could, grabbed your belongings, got in your trucks and headed north towards your hometown in Sydney, Montana using whatever back roads you could to avoid the Californian authorities. When you got home to Sydney, Montana five days later, you were greeted by family and friends and were given the full story of what had happened.

The anthros and their human friends who stayed loyal to them, yourself, your brother and your human friends included, had fled major human populated areas in the southern, eastern, and southwestern states after the order was given, but not all of your people made it out and were either locked up or killed. Those of you who managed to escape had set up a defense in the northern part of the country in the states of Alaska, Washington, Oregon, Idaho, Wyoming, Montana, North Dakota, South Dakota, Minnesota, Wisconsin, Nebraska, and Iowa, for these states had many anthro populations alongside humans in small towns and the humans in theses states had nothing against them, and those humans who did and would rather save their own skin and abandon their anthro friends fled to the part of the country the anthros had fled from. Three weeks later these twelve states had become known as the Allied States of America (A.S.A.) and you soon claimed independence from the United States of America two months after the order was given. Most of the Naval ships had been taken by the anthros in the Pacific and some in the Atlantic and made their way to Washington and Oregon. Most Ships that were under full human control had remained in port in the state of California, and the states on the eastern coast. Large military planes had also been taken by the anthros to get the anthro ground troops home, and any of the human soldiers who sided with them.

Anthros outside of the country were safe from harm for the time being, but you didn't know if the war would spread. Any anthros across the border of Mexico would have a hard time getting into the states if they took the land crossing approach and some even fled to Mexico when the order was given, but they had it a lot easier if they took the water route off the west coast to get to the northern states. The Canadian anthros had no problem, for Canada was not against the anthros and allowed them safe passage to and from their country.

When it was finally known that these northern states had sided with the anthros, the President gave an order to eliminate all towns in these states. But when the order had been given, the A.S.A. had many military personnel capable of piloting air crafts, including anthros, and also had been given enough time to organize their defense. Our people held their soldiers to a stand still, and the President had lost too many air crafts to make a clean sweep over the A.S.A. with an airstrike and their ground troops had fared no better, so the President was unable to push forward. Once we had established the areas that our people were free to roam, we focused on winning back the rest of the states to be united once again, and without the threat of anthros being killed on sight. For a little while we did not have a leader, but soon your S.E.A.L.s mentor, and close anthro wolf friend John Raymond who had black fur, took charge when no one else stood up to the plate, and made it so that if the United States made a move, you would be prepared, and he usually sent you, your brother and your friends on rescue missions to get any anthros and humans fighting for them who were still alive but had been captured, out of their prisons and back to safety, and you were doing a great job, but you were just getting started. Two days ago you had just finished a rescue mission of 2,000 anthros and humans who had been stuck in the United States and now you were back home for a break. You and your friends were all of age and walk into your favorite bar in town, 'The Pub', as it was ironically named and say after finding some seats, "Hey Scarlet, how about a round of your best whiskey for me and my friends here."

"Coming right up boys, this one will be on me," Scarlet says. Scarlet Jennings was an anthro arctic fox who had of course white fur, and Navy blue eyes. She was the single owner of this bar, with no current husband, having taken the place over after her father had died of old age and her mother could not longer run it. Her siblings got into other lines of work, including her brother, Leo Jennings, who was one of your friends and had been a S.E.A.L. with you, and is currently sitting with you. Soon Scarlet came over with the drinks and sits down with all of you to swap conversation.
